name: The Incantator Phantasmic: Rogue 4 / Wizard 35 / Ranger 1
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Having just posted my caster cleric, here is the gnome arcane version.  Just a wizard for the working day.  He can do damn near anything.  A little min-maxed, but not too extreme.

Strengths:
  • Strongest DC Wizard Spells possible (barring some RDD monstrosity)
  • Epic Warding and Epic Mage Armor
  • Can Craft all Deadly Traps
  • Can Disable up to Epic Traps
  • Dual Focused in 2 Spell Schools
  • Can become an Arcane Trebuchet if needed with Normal, Silenced, Empowered & Maximized IGMS
  • UMD (not that it’s needed)
  • Evasion
  • Undispellable
  • Spell Power more than enough to penetrate max toolset SR
  • High Spot & Listen
 
Weaknesses
  • A true wizard has no weaknesses
 
Builder’s Commentary
This is one of those builds that can solo.  It started as off as another EDR III Wizard with tri-focus in spell schools, but I was somewhat disillusioned with the outcome.  I retooled it and made my bent on attaining the best DCs possible in 2 spell schools while still maintaining a wee bit of hardiness.  I enjoyed the pure power in this one more, particularly when it came to traps.  In addition to being capable of dealing with most traps, he is quite adept at making his own.  He has a butt-tonne of skill points (over 400) so one will find one’s self running out of skills to max out.  One will notice I even maxed out Discipline.
 
The oft-overlooked feat of Strong Soul was selected at 1st level because I like how not only do you get the bonus to Fort and Will, but you get a further bonus to Death Magic. Necromancy was chosen for the obvious winner spells in the Wizard repertoire, and Illusion for some early goodness on the front end (Color Spray and Phantasmal Killer).  Mass Blindness is a great spell if you’re in a party and all your rogue friends will love you if you keep this one memorized.
 
One of the goals in this build was to get max Intelligence (38), so that when buffed you reach (50).  Ahh, 50….
Silent Spell is chosen for the obvious Silenced IGMS, and is useful in general against Silenced-based opponents.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings GDL!
Build looks great. 
I love how you have such a flashy writing style and terrific substance.
Heaps of spells, fantastic spell DC from Int 38->50, two epic spell foci, rogue to invest piles of skill points into, metamagic, scribe scroll/craft wand, and very nice base HP for a DC wizard, it looks very solid indeed, the type of build I'd love to play, 40 to saves against spells is fabulous. 
You clearly had too many skill points to spend if you have found a way to craft deadly gas traps with 100% success (DC 45 with no Take 20) into the build, it is a very flashy feature, well done :) 
With Set Trap 38(41) you are so close to being able to set Epic traps outside of combat with 45 modified with an empowered Cat's Grace spell, maybe just by adding a few points you can add another flashy and powerful feature, not that you need more
Also I thought there should be a 20% XP penalty at level 39 and 40 from Ranger 1 onwards. 
I also believe you wrote you maxed discipline but didn't include it in the the post
I think it makes little difference to the whole picture, I think I'm searching for a suggestion or improvement that doesn't really change of the core substance, which is a very solid and flashy build

Hope that helps, thanks for taking the effort to post this up
